triples.name: Complex network
triples.relevance: Complex networks provide the foundational framework for modeling and understanding the topological structures studied in this paper.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Reinforcement learning is the core technique used to enable individuals to learn optimal strategies through interactions with their network neighbors.

triples.name: Evolutionary game theory
triples.relevance: Evolutionary game theory provides the theoretical framework for modeling games among individuals and their strategy evolution in the population.

triples.name: Community structure
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel approach to understanding community structure emergence through networked evolution with birth-death processes and reinforcement learning.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: Q-learning is the specific reinforcement learning algorithm used for agents to select and optimize their actions within the network.

triples.name: Birth-death process
triples.relevance: The paper proposes integrating birth-death processes into the networked evolution model to capture individual population dynamics.

triples.name: Population dynamics
triples.relevance: Population dynamics theory underpins the understanding of how individual birth, death, and behavior affect overall system evolution.
